sprout.name: Sprout
sprout.roles: Full-stack Developer, Project Manager, Designer, and Product Owner
sprout.description:
Sprout is a social gardening application to promote bee-friendly and native-plant gardens across the Greater Vancouver area. Using the application, the Sprout team hoped to inspire users to connect with their community and learn more about the ecosystem around them.

As a Full-Stack Developer, some of my most notable contributions to the project includes the implementation of both the back and front-end of a user's sprout profiles (each individual plant's record), plant database search, plant database results, alerts, and leaderboard. Plant data collected was provided with courtesy from Kwantlen Polytechnic University's School of Horticulture (2015).

üèÜ Sprout is awarded Best Design in BCIT CST program's Projects II for the term of Fall/Winter 2021 out of 51 total projects.
sprout.retrospective: When my team and I started out, we were thinking of ways to bring technology into sustainable living. I‚Äôve been interested in the cause of protecting bees and Nicholas, our back-end developer, was getting into gardening and wanted to learn more about native plants in the Vancouver area. We combined these two ideas with an element of community because we all learned to emphasize how important community is after studying online throughout the pandemic.

successes.text: Completed a full PWA from scratch within 5-weeks.
Self-taught and applied new technologies such as React.js, Axios, Heroku, and Postgres/SQL under a condensed timeline after 3 months of coding.
Individually learned to connect front-end to back-end through studying back-end peers' code.
Quick problem solving and prioritizing minimum viable product goals
A glorious front-end that was awarded Best Design amongst 51 total projects.
Learning to create meaningful bonds within a team of strangers!
Thorough documentation for future improvements and implementations.

potentials.text: Implement a log-in process that will keep users logged in even after page refresh.
Expand on the social aspect of the application with better team engagement, forums, or chat options.
Inproving SQL statements to make use of aggregate functions, reducing the front-end processing load.
Creating team challenges to engage each community team.
CSS file clean-up, to create a consolidated, shared style sheet for page components with similar styling.
Polish bugs such as encryption for password and large image size upload.

successes.text: Prioritized MVP and leveraged our skill-level to create a simple yet good-looking design.
Implemented update, add, and remove calls to Firestore, a NoSQL database.
Individually integrated a log-in/log-out and update settings process for users.
Successfully implemented my first alerts page.
Managed a team of three efficiently so that we were ahead of our deliverable timeline.

potentials.text: The organization of our NoSQL database can be improved, in specific, for our scheduling and marketing pages.
The application can be expanded to allow one user to have access to more than one store location.
